request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Health Information Authorization Form (Form 1085)
Mail to Copley Hospital HIM, 528 Washington Hwy, Morrisville VT 05661

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (dual-purpose: patient self-access and third-party release)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A single dual-purpose authorization form with a checkbox for 'Provide a copy of my records to: Me' alongside third-party release fields.

red_flags: No fillable fields despite digitally authored PDF — forces print-and-handwrite workflow
Purpose of Release field present without clarification that it is optional for patient self-requests
bright_spots: Comprehensive electronic delivery options including email, USB, CD, and patient portal
Clear plain-language voluntariness statement: 'My treatment will not be impacted, no matter if I sign this Authorization or not'
Single-page form covering all necessary content efficiently
Patient portal nudge: 'Many documents that you may be requesting are available to you in your patient portal'

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — form is directly linked from the Medical Records page under main navigation and immediately surfaced by web search.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax submission available — the PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite, though fax submission provides an electronic return path.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — logical single-page layout with clear sections and plain language, but the dense formatting and ambiguous 'Purpose of Release' field for self-requests are minor drawbacks.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form includes a 'Me' checkbox but patients must navigate third-party release fields, a purpose-of-release field, and authorization framing rather than access-right framing.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — no fee disclosure despite HIPAA requirements, purpose-of-release field without opt-out clarification for self-requests, and no explicit Right of Access framing, though voluntariness and revocation language are solid.

overall.summary: Copley Hospital offers easy findability and a compact, plain-language form with strong delivery options, but the lack of fillable fields, absence of fee disclosure, and generic authorization framing rather than dedicated patient access pathway hold it back from a higher grade.
